marketNews.title: Coal Production Exceeds Government Target
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) reported that national coal production reached 711.37 million tonnes as of 15 November 2024, surpassing the 2024 government target of 710 million tonnes. The 2024 target is itself 2.2% higher than the 2023 target of 695 million tonnes. Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, Gita Mahyarani, predicts that national coal production for 2024 will be around 800 million tonnes, 3.2% higher than the 2023 realization of 775 million tonnes. Of the total national coal production as of 15 November 2024, 50.6% (359 million tonnes) was exported, representing 69.3% of the 2023 export realization. marketNews.title: Analysts Expect Slower, Shallower Rate Cuts in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that analysts see Bank Indonesia likely to implement slower and smaller benchmark interest‑rate cuts due to global uncertainty that threatens rupiah stability. Most analysts expect a longer pause in rate cuts because of geopolitical tension and protective policies from the Donald Trump administration, which could delay U.S. Federal Reserve easing and boost demand for safe‑haven assets such as the U.S. dollar. Bloomberg noted that some analysts still forecast a BI Rate cut in December 2024, but the majority anticipate a wait until 2025. Bloomberg Economics also does not rule out a possible rate hike within 12 months if financial market volatility worsens.

marketNews.title: U.S. Vetoes UN‑Security Council Cease‑Fire Resolution on Israel‑Palestine Conflict
marketNews.content: The United States blocked a draft cease‑fire resolution on the Israel‑Palestine conflict at the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday (20 November), marking the fourth time the U.S. has used its veto during the conflict to protect its ally Israel.

marketNews.title: Bitcoin Hits All‑Time High Above US$97,000
marketNews.content: Bitcoin surged to a record high of US$97,862 on Thursday 21 November, the first time the cryptocurrency breached the US$97,000 level. The recent price strength has been driven by positive market sentiment following Donald Trump’s election victory, during which he promised pro‑crypto measures if elected.

marketNews.title: Apple Submits $100 Million Investment Proposal to Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Industry’s spokesperson, Febri Hendri Antoni Arif, said the ministry has received a US$100 million investment proposal from Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL). If the investment materialises, Apple will obtain a domestic component certificate (TKDN), allowing the iPhone 16 to be sold officially in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Says Indonesia Can Reach Net‑Zero by 2030
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto said Indonesia is optimistic about achieving net‑zero emissions before 2050, a decade earlier than the previous target. He also announced plans to shut down all coal‑fired and fossil‑fuel power plants within 15 years, accelerating the previous 2056 target, and to build 75 GW of renewable power capacity in the same period. Reuters noted that Indonesia’s current power capacity exceeds 90 GW, with renewables contributing less than 15% of the total.

marketNews.title: Hotel Occupancy Projected to Fall 10% YoY for 2025 Holiday Season
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Hotel and Restaurant Association, Hariyadi Sukamdani, projected that hotel occupancy during the 2025 Christmas and New Year (Nataru) period will decline 10% year‑on‑year. The projection is based on slower hotel bookings compared with the previous year, with weaker consumer purchasing power cited as a key cause.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Coal Production 55.6 Million Tonnes (+9.5% YoY) in 9M24
tickerNews.content: $ADRO reported coal production of 55.6 million tonnes in the first nine months of 2024, a 9.5% year‑on‑year increase.

tickerNews.title: ITMG Coal Production 15 Million Tonnes (+11.1% YoY) in 9M24
tickerNews.content: $ITMG produced 15 million tonnes of coal in the first nine months of 2024, up 11.1% year‑on‑year.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Coal Production 33 Million Tonnes (+3.4% YoY) in 9M24
tickerNews.content: $PTBA generated 33 million tonnes of coal in the first nine months of 2024, a 3.4% year‑on‑year increase.

tickerNews.title: BUMI Coal Production 37.7 Million Tonnes (+7% YoY) in 1H24
tickerNews.content: $BUMI reported coal production of 37.7 million tonnes in the first half of 2024, a 7% year‑on‑year increase.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Lowers 2024 Komatsu Sales Guidance to 4,350 Units
tickerNews.content: $UNTR said in an analyst meeting on Thursday 21 November that the company revised its 2024 Komatsu heavy‑equipment sales guidance down to 4,350 units from 4,500 units due to delivery delays. The company had previously raised the 2024 guidance in September from 4,000 to 4,500 units. The 2024 coal‑production guidance was also raised from 144 million tonnes to 147 million tonnes.

tickerNews.title: UNTR 2025 Guidance: 4,600 Komatsu Units, 150 Million Tonnes Coal, 1.25 Bcm Overburden, 14 Million Tonnes Coal Sales, 240 Thousand Ounces Gold, 2 Million Tonnes Nickel
tickerNews.content: $UNTR provided 2025 guidance of 4,600 Komatsu units (+5.7% YoY), coal production of 150 million tonnes (+2% YoY), overburden volume of 1.25 billion cubic metres (+2% YoY), coal sales of 14 million tonnes (+6.1% YoY), gold sales of 240,000 ounces (+2.1% YoY) and nickel ore sales of 2 million tonnes (+5.3% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTPP Signs Fiber‑Optic Infrastructure Sale to Unnamed Telecom Operator
tickerNews.content: PT PP’s President Director Novel Arsyad said the company has signed a sales agreement for PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi – a PT PP subsidiary operating in the telecommunications infrastructure sector, specifically fiber‑optic, with an unnamed Indonesian telecom operator. The transaction value and buyer identity were not disclosed, but the deal is expected to close in December 2024. The sale is part of PT PP’s plan to divest assets worth up to IDR 1 trillion in 2024 to reduce long‑term debt, which stood at IDR 11.31 trillion as of 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: INDY Targets 50% Non‑Coal Revenue by 2028
tickerNews.content: Indika Energy’s Vice President of Operations, Azis Armand, said the company now targets non‑coal business to contribute 50% of total revenue by 2028, three years later than the previous 2025 target. The revision reflects the still‑under‑performing non‑coal subsidiaries. He added that gold mining and port‑logistics infrastructure will become the company’s focus, and INDY aims to start production at the Awak Mas gold mine (a subsidiary) in 2H 2026 with an output of 100,000 ounces per year.

tickerNews.title: DSSA Plans IDR 2.5 Trillion Bond and IDR 959 Billion Sukuk Issuance
tickerNews.content: Dian Swastatika Sentosa announced a bond issuance of IDR 2.5 trillion and a sukuk issuance of IDR 959 billion. Proceeds will be used for refinancing, data‑center development, home‑pass network construction, and a geothermal power plant (PLTP). The issuances consist of three series (370‑day, 3‑year, and 5‑year) with interest/yield rates of 6.5%, 8.125% and 8.625% respectively. Both series received an idAA rating and an idAA(sy) rating from Pefindo. The public offering is scheduled for 21 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Cement Sales Decline in October 2024
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia reported cement sales of 3.8 million tonnes in October 2024, down 3% YoY but up 14% month‑on‑month. The decline in the 10‑month total to 31.7 million tonnes represents a 4% YoY drop. The October decline was driven by a 2% YoY (14% MoM) fall in Indonesian‑facility sales (3.7 million tonnes) and a 16% YoY (32% MoM) fall in Vietnam‑facility sales (88.6 thousand tonnes) as exports remain halted. Bag‑type cement accounted for 69.8% of total sales in October (vs. 69.9% in September).

tickerNews.title: SGER Secures 500,000‑Ton Coal Supply Contract with Vietnamese Power Generator
tickerNews.content: $SGER announced a contract to supply 500,000 tonnes of coal to Vietnam’s Power Generation Corporation. Transaction value was not disclosed; delivery will occur over six months from the contract date. The coal’s net calorific value is 4,600 kcal/kg.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Posts 9M24 Net Profit of IDR 934 Billion (+43% YoY)
tickerNews.content: $SMRA reported a net profit of IDR 180 billion in 3Q24 (‑15% YoY, ‑42% QoQ) due to a 10% YoY (‑47% QoQ) decline in revenue, mainly from a 26% YoY (‑61% QoQ) drop in development‑segment revenue and a 39% YoY (‑67% QoQ) decline in the residential sub‑segment. Despite the quarterly weakness, 9M24 net profit reached IDR 934 billion, 87% of the FY24 consensus estimate. Revenue recognition grew 49% YoY, gross‑margin expanded 240 basis points YoY and operating‑margin expanded 630 basis points YoY, delivering an operating profit of IDR 2.8 trillion (+80% YoY), above the FY24 consensus of IDR 2.4 trillion.

tickerNews.title: PPRI Directors Sell 15 Million Shares Each at IDR 105–106
tickerNews.content: Paperocks Indonesia directors Catur Jatiwaluyo and Dillon Sutandar each sold 15 million PPRI shares at IDR 105 and IDR 106 per share respectively, for a total transaction value of IDR 1.6 billion each. After the sales, Catur’s stake fell from 18.6% to 17.21% and Dillon’s from 26.05% to 24.65%.
